translations.translation: Then the angels prostrated all together, every one of them -
The angels bowed in homage in a body
So, the angels - all of them - fell down in prostration,
All the angels prostrated before Adam
Therefore all the angels, each and every one of them, fell prostrate.
So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together.
So the angels made obeisance, all of them together,
Then the angels bowed themselves all together,
So the angels fell prostrate, all of them together
then the angels all prostrated themselves together.
So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together.
Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,
So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
So, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together.
So the angels prostrated themselves, all together.
So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
[15:30] And so the angels prostrated, all of them together (kulluhum ajma‘ūn contains two elements of emphasis),
(So the angels fell prostrate) to Adam (pbuh) (all of them together)

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: ولما سمعوا الأمر الوجوبي القطعي { فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلاۤئِكَةُ } بلا طلب مرجح ودليل { كُلُّهُمْ } بلا خروج واحد منهم { أَجْمَعُونَ } [الحجر: 30] مجتمعون معاً بلا تقدم وتأخر، وتردد وتسويف
